intro: Swertia elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed swertia, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Swertia elongata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal practices for their potential health benefits.
